com.n9mtq4.logwindow.utils

Class StringParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.n9mtq4.logwindow.utils.StringParser
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public final class StringParser
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Contains the text, that is sent to the BaseConsole, as well as some String manipulation methods.
    Since:
    v0.1
    Version:
    v5.0
    Author:
    Will "n9Mtq4" Bresnahan
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Gets the string in between two other strings.
      "Hello World".getBetween("lo", "ld") returns " wor"
      "first second third first again".getBetween("second", "first") returns " third "

      Gives you the number of words that the user inputed.

    • Method Detail

      • getArg

        public final java.lang.String getArg(int i)
        The text of the command is split into words. getArg returns the word at the given index.

        "Hello Java World".getArg(1) returns "Java"
        "Hello Java World".getArg(4) throws StringIndexOutOfBoundsException

        Parameters:
        i - the index of the word
        Returns:
        The word at the given index.
        Throws:
        java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException - when the index is more than the number of words - 1 (first word is 0)
        Since:
        v0.1

      • trim

        public final java.lang.String trim()
        Trims off the whitespace at the end of the text of the command.
        Returns:
        the trimmed string.
        Since:
        v0.1
        See Also:
        String.trim()

      • eqt

        public final boolean eqt(java.lang.String s)
        Does the same thing as String.trim().equalsIgnoreCase()
        trims the string then equalsIgnoreCase
        Parameters:
        s - The comparing
        Returns:
        The boolean of string.trim().equalsIgnoreCase(s)
        Since:
        v0.1
        See Also:
        String.trim(), String.equalsIgnoreCase(java.lang.String)

      • startsWith

        public final boolean startsWith(java.lang.String s)
        Returns if the text of the command starts with the given String
        Same as getText().startsWith(s)
        Parameters:
        s - The comparing
        Returns:
        boolean of string.startsWith(s);
        Since:
        v0.1
        See Also:

      • getWordsStartingFrom

        public final java.lang.String getWordsStartingFrom(int startIndex)
        Gets a word starting from word index.

        "Hello Java World".getWordsStartingFrom(0) returns "Hello Java World"
        "Hello Java World".getWordsStartingFrom(1) returns "Java World"
        "Hello Java World".getWordsStartingFrom(4) returns null

        Parameters:
        startIndex - Index of the word to get the string there-on.
        Returns:
        The cropped string.
        Since:
        v0.1

      • getBeforePattern

        public final java.lang.String getBeforePattern(java.lang.String pattern)
        Gets the string before a pattern.
        "Hello Java World".getBeforePattern("Java") returns "Hello "
        Parameters:
        pattern - The pattern to search for.
        Returns:
        The string before the pattern.
        Since:
        v0.1

      • getBetween

        public final java.lang.String getBetween(java.lang.String before,
                                         java.lang.String after)
        Gets the string in between two other strings.
        "Hello World".getBetween("lo", "ld") returns " wor"
        "first second third first again".getBetween("second", "first") returns " third "
        Parameters:

        after - The string after.
        Returns:
        The string in between.
        Since:
        v0.1
